content.description: The obvious splitter between the triangular roof and Maria's Bed (the inverted staircase).  The route, like many other schoolroom lines, feels a little steeper than it looks.  Some of the finger locks and handjams are kind of painful and the feet on this one seem to disappear near the end. You can either climb easy ground to the left, under the roof, then work your way back right to the main splitter, or tackle the thin seam that leads directly into it.  If going up the seam, don't worry, there is a bomber hidden nut placement right in the middle. A top rope should be easy to set up after doing Little Early-Pearly if you hiked up without gear.
content.protection: Standard rack to 3". Use mostly TCUs, though, for protection.  Rap Hangars at the top.

content.description:
This is the sport route up the inverted staircase about 20 feet right of the triangular roof.  The climbing consists of steep fun moves between jugs requiring some powerful lockoffs. The rock on the first half is kind of marginal, but the rock on the upper half is bomber.  There are three different cruxes - one between bolts three and four, one rocking up onto the slab after bolt five, and one to finish the route off to the jug for clipping the chains.

Reaching a key jug at the 5th bolt is fairly height dependent.

The route was initially climbed without the 1st and 6th bolts, but was retro'd to make it a bit safer.

The bolted slab to the right of Maria's Bed (the inverted staircase). The crux involves some thin moves at the 4th bolt, but is otherwise 10+ish climbing prior to and after the bolt. Not much for endurance, it may be an easy first 5.12 for someone good at bouldering.
